info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 11:23PM CDT until June 5 at 9:44AM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri...
Hinkson Creek at Columbia.
River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Hinkson Creek at Columbia.
* WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.7 feet, Height of the football practice field, protected by a levee to about 25.5 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 15.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 18.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage to 14.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage to 17.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage again late tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change.
This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/lsx

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING
